title: Chinese etiquette & ethics in business
abstract: New economies are developing in the People's Republic of China, Taiwan, and Hong Kong - and Western technology, management expertise, and capital are helping to fuel them. But every gain is hard won and Western businesspeople who are successful need to know the ins and outs of bureaucracy, political systems, and the character. In this new edition of Chinese Etiquette and Ethics in Business, Lafayette De Mente, who has lived and worked in the Far East for over thirty years, reveals the historic factors, collective traits, and individual qualities that determine how the do business today, and the direction their economies will take in the future. His' is an insider's view, whether he is discussing the overhaul of laws controlling business development or the importance of good social relationships to successful business relationships. If you are a businessperson who'd like to do business with the successfully - Chinese Etiquette and Ethics in Business should be at the top of your read list. Boye De Mente is a life-long student and observer of Asia; an unchallenged authority on Asian etiquette and ethics in business. Few books are so well documented, with so many tips and things to know about today's China. Chinese Etiquette and Ethics in Business is must reading for anyone contemplating a business venture there. - Professor Andrew C. Chang, American Graduate School of International Management.
